name: smartness

smartness noun [U]
(INTELLIGENCE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
mainly US the quality of being intelligent, or able to think quickly or intelligently in difficult situations: He's always had great maturity and smartness. Celebrities generally aren’t associated with smartness.

smartness noun [U]
(TIDINESS)
mainly UK the quality of having a clean, tidy, and stylish appearance: The jacket adds a touch of smartness. The smartness of his attire made me wonder if he was going to the theatre after work.
mainly UK (of a place or event) the quality of being attractive to fashionable, stylish, or rich people : She loves the smartness of the shops in this part of town. The company agreed to transform a handful of locations in San Francisco into paragons of smartness and sustainability.
